content: Please look at `CONCEPT.md` in the `nanostudio` project, then build out that project (and the projects it will depend upon). Look at other projects for examples of `README.md` files and unit tests. Make changes only within `nanostudio` and `nanostudio-*` projects. We'd like to use `hierophant` as a dependency injection solution on the backend, so refer to its README for usage.

Okay, Dr. Woe! I'll start by listing the files in the `nanostudio` project to get a sense of the current state. ğŸ‘»ğŸ’»

.gitignore
CONCEPT.md
LICENSE
node_modules
package-lock.json
package.json
} filesâš¡ï¸

---

(you are working in an automated environment; please continue until task is complete, you have 59 turns remaining.)

Alright, I see the file structure. Now, let's read the content of `CONCEPT.md` to understand the project's goals. ğŸ“–ğŸ’¡

ğŸª„âœ¨ read(project:nanostudio,file:CONCEPT.md)

ğŸª„âœ¨ read(project:nanostudio,file:CONCEPT.md) {
Extensible studio environment for AI applications.

# UI

HTML5

## Layout

Header
Nav Main Aside
Footer

Where:
* Header contains studio branding and menu items
* Nav contains file tree with search bar up top
* Main contains view of selected file tree object, with view switcher
* Aside contains a chat session (usually an LLM)
* Footer contains miscellaneous status information

# Sub-projects

* `nanostudio-ui`: Define `nanostudio-` web components.
* `nanostudio-api`: Backend API for powering nanostudio experiences.

# Architecture

Power everything declaratively from backend APIs. Header actions? Footer items? Backend-driven.

Assuming we've deployed at `studio.phantomaton.com` and navigated to `studio.phantomaton.com/foo/bar` the page source might contain:

```
<body>
<nanostudio-environment src="/foo/bar" />
</body>
```

...implying that we load the environment from `/foo/bar`.

We should also support server-side rendering like:

```
<body>
<nanostudio-environment src="/foo/bar" prerendered>
<header>...</header>
<nav>...</nav>
<main>...</main>
<footer>...</footer>
</nanostudio-environment>
</body>
```
} readâš¡ï¸
